title: I'm sure this will be easy for someone... sans serif
author: AleshaB

comments.content:
Ryuk, what earmarks told you this was Raleway? Nothing about that sample struck me as unusual, so I am sure I would never have known where to look. Is this a popular font?

- Mike Yanega

I recognized it at first sight and mainly immediately confirmed by the 4 upper terminals /W. I know it very well as I'm using it a lot for web purpose ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055815/http:/www.lokoodreams.com/) for instance). I like its cleanness, legibility/readability, large range and subtle impact. It is somehow a free alternative to Gotham.

Thanks Ryuk. Since posting my comment I looked into Raleway and found it was a Google Font. I have failed to look into these fonts before and found about 140 serif fonts that might need to be added to my Guide. I saw some familiar fonts, and a few that seemed like renames of existing designs (not cool!), but also a lot that seemed original.

Has there been any discussion of the merits/demerits of the Google Fonts?

- Mike Yanega

> Has there been any discussion of the merits/demerits of the Google Fonts?

Could be but I don't know any, may be on other Typophile board like Discussion one...  
- [https://www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fn...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055815/https:/www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fnode+%22google+webfonts "https://www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fnode+%22google+webfonts")  
- [https://www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fn...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055815/https:/www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fnode+%22google+web+fonts%22 "https://www.google.com/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=site%3Atypophile.com%2Fnode+%22google+web+fonts%22")
